question: In which of the following places the largest number of terracottas were manufactured during the post-Mauryan period?
explanation: In the post-Mauryan period, beautiful pieces of terracotta produced in profuse quantities. The largest number of terracotta and moulds were manufactured at Velleshwaram in the Nalgonda district of Telangana. The terracotta figures were mostly meant for the use of upper classes in towns.
